reps.name: Matt Chubb

top_objections.objection: I don't have the capital right now
It's more expensive than I expected
I need to talk to my wife/spouse

strengths: Best on team at handling price/budget objections (61% win rate vs 42% team average)
Excellent at explaining financing options with specific numbers
Strong ROI/value demonstration skills
development_areas: Authority objections (42% win rate vs 52% team average)
Needs to improve getting spouse/partner on three-way calls
Sometimes accepts 'I'll talk to them' without securing next call

best_call.response: Immediately pivoted to financing, showed multiple options, gave specific numbers

coaching_recommendations: Practice getting spouse on three-way call
Send follow-up emails addressed to BOTH parties

reps.name: Lyle Hubbard

top_objections.objection: I don't have the capital right now
It's more expensive than I expected
I need to talk to my wife/spouse

strengths: Best on team at technical/logistics questions (84% win rate)
Excellent at explaining lead generation process
Strong product knowledge
development_areas: 'I can figure this out on my own' objections (25% win rate vs 76% team average) - CRITICAL GAP
Sometimes offers to unbundle program (VenHub only) which devalues offering
Needs to defend full program value more assertively
reps.critical_issue: When prospects say they have resources/connections, Lyle offers 'just VenHub access' instead of showing value of full program. This devalues the offering and creates precedent for discounts.

worst_call.objection: I can figure this out with my resources

coaching_recommendations: Study Matt's calls where DIY objection surfaces
reps.target_improvement: Bring DIY win rate to 45%+ by end of month

reps.name: Christian Hartwell

top_objections.objection: I don't have the capital right now
I want to test this first before investing
I need time to think about it

strengths: Excellent at logistics questions (78% win rate)
Strong empathy and rapport building
Good at directing to community for solutions
development_areas: 'I want to test first' objections (29% win rate vs 76% team average) - CRITICAL GAP
Capital objections (44% win rate vs 58% team average)
Needs to show cost of DIY/testing more effectively
reps.critical_issue: Christian empathizes with DIY mindset but doesn't effectively show the time/money cost of testing alone. He accepts the objection too easily without reframing.

best_call.objection: How do I stock with 9-5 job?
best_call.response: Directed to community, explained time commitment

coaching_recommendations: Study Jordan's approach to competitive/DIY objections
Practice showing cost of testing: time (6-9 months), money ($3-5K in mistakes), opportunity cost
Offer Bronze as 'guided test' rather than accepting full DIY
reps.target_improvement: Bring 'test first' win rate to 45%+ by end of month

reps.name: Jordan Humphrey

top_objections.objection: For that price, I'd expect you to find locations for me
I don't have the capital right now
It's more expensive than I expected

strengths: BEST on team at competitive/saturation objections (78% win rate)
Excellent at showing empathy while maintaining momentum
Strong at theft/risk objections (82% win rate)
Outstanding call where prospect's mom had died - showed empathy and still closed
development_areas: 'For that price, find locations for me' (33% win rate - but BEST on team, objection is very challenging)
Faces this objection 3x more than other reps (8% vs 2.8% team average)
reps.investigation_needed: Jordan faces 'for that price, find locations' objection 8% of his calls vs 2.8% team average. Need to investigate lead sources or call flow.

objections: I'm not ready to start right now
best_call.response: Showed empathy, reframed timing, explained competitive advantage

reps.name: Adrian Sherrod

top_objections.objection: I don't have the capital right now
It's more expensive than I expected
Where do I store inventory?

strengths: BEST on team at logistics questions (91% win rate)
Perfect 100% win rate on storage questions
Excellent at providing practical solutions
development_areas: 'I want to test first' objections (38% win rate vs 76% team average)
reps.coaching_opportunity: When 'test first' objection surfaces, Adrian should pivot to logistics complexity: 'Let me show you what testing looks like: finding wholesale suppliers, negotiating with 10+ locations, learning which products sell where, managing cash flow.'

best_call.objection: Where do I store inventory? I don't want people coming to my home.
best_call.response: Practical solutions (garage, storage unit, delivery requirements)

reps.name: Scott Seymour

top_objections.objection: I want to wait until my business can pay for it
I don't have the capital right now
I need to talk to my wife/spouse

strengths: BEST on team at 'wait until business is profitable' objections (42% vs 35% team average)
Excellent framing: 'gas on fire vs starting fire'
Strong at authority objections when he gets spouse on call
development_areas: Sometimes accepts timing objection too easily without uncovering root concern

best_call.response: Perfect framing - 'gas on fire vs start the fire'

should_train_team_on: His 'gas on fire' framing for timing objections
